There's been a huge movement towards infantilizing teenagers instead of moving them towards independence. I see a ton of people online saying how horrible it is for teens to work part time when they're in school. Having a part-time job was super common when I was a kid.
Also, shit costs more. You’re not getting a $2 matinee anymore and the minimum wage hasn’t gone up since you still could.

JK Rowling is now claiming that the Nazis didn’t burn books on trans healthcare. In fact the Institut für Sexualwissenschaft (Institute for Sexology) was active in Berlin for 14 years until it, along with its libraries, were destroyed by the Nazis in 1933.

It was the first of its kind in the world, with pioneering research on LGBT & intersex healthcare. It was led by Magnus Hirschfield, a dedicated campaigner for LGBT rights (who was mocked on the front cover of Der Stürmer in 1929 for his Jewish ancestry & theories on sex, gender & sexuality)

I would like, at this point, to remind people in general that denial or minimisation or Nazi crimes is a form of *Holocaust denial* As a Jewish cis woman I find this as appalling & evil when aimed at trans Holocaust victims as I would if it were aimed at my own ancestors.

Did you know? The word “trumpery” appeared in the 15th century with the meanings “deceit” or “fraud”. 100 years later, it was being applied to objects of no value. Then in the 1900’s, it came to mean “showy but worthless”. Today, it is equated with “treasonous shitweasel”.
